DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Organ And/Or System Involvement Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the organ and/or system that was involved with chronic graft versus host disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Organ And/Or System Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions.  It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.  Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: A part of the body that performs a specific function.  For example, the heart is an organ.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly._Text; the words of something written.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: Specify the other site of the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specify the other site of the organ / system involvement with chronic GVHD:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping for CDE:2793844
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedDiagnosis.resultClassificationCode(CD).originalText WHERE PerfornedDiagnosis.value = "GVHD" AND PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode = "chronic" AND PerformedDiagnosis.resultClassificationCode(CD).nullFlavor = "OTH" AND PerformedDiagnosis > PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = "assess organ/system involvement"
